intro: Cassuvium, commonly known as the golden sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single bloom. The plant features broad, waxy leaves and produces vibrant yellow flowers that turn orange as they mature. Cassuvium is known for its drought tolerance and ability to thrive in poor soil conditions. Its seeds are often used for ornamental purposes and in traditional herbal remedies.
